text: so the sensor network is a it's a
network of rasby P mini computers
equipped with sensors to Monitor and
measure things in the environment so
temperature humidity light levels um
also Acoustics whether it's from
Wildlife or from people or from traffic
and we're looking at all different kinds
of environments we're using hydrophones
in the pond ultrasonic microphones to
pick up
bats and all this data is brought
together with other people's data other
people work in the garden so
environmental DNA visual observations
bring all this together which probably
like the most intensively studied Urban
site in the world and then that data is
kind of aggregated in our data ecosystem
which is built on Amazon web services
which gives us a holistic picture of all
the science in the gardens and from that
we can do further research and policy to
look at increasing the rate of UK nature
recovery
